Slow-cooked BBQ Pulled Chicken

29 Mar 2017

Ingredients (2 Servings)

600g chicken
100ml barbecue sauce
15ml olive oil
1 medium onion
1 tbsp. worcestershire sauce
1 tbsp.brown sugar OR honey

Spices

cayenne
Nutrition Values
Per 412g Serving Size
kcal
474
Total Fat 
9.4g
Saturated Fat
n/a
Trans Fat
n/a
Sodium
1389mg
Total Carbohydrates 
26.7g
Sugars
21.5g
Dietary Fiber
1.6g
Protein 
70g




This is very easy to make. All you need is a big pot and patience. The flavors come out very distinctive in this one, as the long cooking time allows the meat to assimilate all spices.
Preparation
Cut up chicken breast into medium sized chunks. Form doesn't matter, so this can be done quick. Chop onion. Throw all ingredients into a big pot, add some water and let lightly boil on medium for 3-4 hours. After that take two forks and pull that chicken apart. Let simmer for another hour or until the water has evaporated and all that's left is saucy, steamy BBQ-chicken. Eat with whatever you like, I like it to cauliflower pur√©e and salad, as seen in the pictures. Refrigerates well, so you can make more at one time and leave it in the fridge. Even tastes good cold.
